content:
• Thursday, March 22, 2012
  • CPWM

    More on Cost Plus (NASDAQ:CPWM): Q4 beat Street estimates across-the-board on a jump in sales....

    More on Cost Plus (NASDAQ:CPWM): Q4 beat Street estimates across-the-board on a jump in sales. Same store sales for the quarter increased 7.6%, largely due to a 3.4% increase in its customer count and a 4.1% jump in the average ticket per customer. Shares +7% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:00 PM
  • XTNT

    Bacterin International (BONE) takes a hit in the post session after posting a wider Q4 loss and...

    Bacterin International (BONE) takes a hit in the post session after posting a wider Q4 loss and missing consensus estimates. Revenue actually jumped 72% Y/Y, but its bottom line was negatively impacted by increased discounting on stocking purchase orders and non recurring adjustments. Shares -11% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:47 PM
  • CE

    Celanese (NYSE:CE) receives Chinese government approval to proceed with previously announced...

    Celanese (NYSE:CE) receives Chinese government approval to proceed with previously announced plans to modify and enhance its existing integrated acetyl facility at the Nanjing Chemical Industrial Park to produce ethanol for industrial uses. The facility is expected to startup in mid-2013. Shares +1.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:05 PM
  • SCS

    More on Steelcase (NYSE:SCS): Q4 misses on a per share basis despite a 10% jump in Y/Y revenue....

    More on Steelcase (NYSE:SCS): Q4 misses on a per share basis despite a 10% jump in Y/Y revenue. Earnings rose 43% on stronger organic sales in the Americas, which helped offset slower growth overseas. The company issues a cautious outlook for Q1 however, now seeing revenues between $665M - $690M and an EPS in the range of $0.08 - $0.12. The Street is at $0.16 a share on $671M in sales. Shares -3.5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:55 PM
  • SBUX

    Teavana (TEA), the most heavily-shorted stock in America, gains 3% AH after KeyBanc's Edward...

    Teavana (TEA), the most heavily-shorted stock in America, gains 3% AH after KeyBanc's Edward Yruma starts coverage with a Buy and $28 PT. Yruma praises Teavana's 19% operating margin, and thinks it could expand further as loose tea sales grow. He also think EPS growth will exceed 25%, and compares Teavana favorably to other "lifestyle-focused retailers" such as Lululemon and Zumiez.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:29 PM
  • LAYN

    Layne Christensen (NASDAQ:LAYN) resumes trading down 10.8%, hitting new 52-week lows after...

    Layne Christensen (NASDAQ:LAYN) resumes trading down 10.8%, hitting new 52-week lows after issuing an FQ4 warning, and disclosing it has found information suggesting bribes were made to African government officials.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:00 PM
  • BHGE

    Baker Hughes (BHI) has tumbled 10% since yesterday's disappointing forecast, and today Barclays...

    Baker Hughes (BHI) has tumbled 10% since yesterday's disappointing forecast, and today Barclays analyst James West reduced his EPS estimates on the oilfield equipment company for the second time in three days. While maintaining an Overweight rating on BHI, he now prefers Halliburton (NYSE:HAL), as it trades at just 8.5x his 2012 estimates, vs. BHI’s 12x.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:38 PM | 3 Comments
  • LAYN

    Layne Christensen (NASDAQ:LAYN) expects to a record a $70M-$80M impairment charge for FQ4, due...

    Layne Christensen (NASDAQ:LAYN) expects to a record a $70M-$80M impairment charge for FQ4, due to weakness in its water infrastructure business. This weakness leads it to forecast EPS will be near breakeven (excluding the charges), below a $0.37 consensus. Layne also says an investigation regarding bribes to African officials has found documents suggesting "improper payments" were made over a long period of time, and the DOJ and SEC are investigating. Shares are halted. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • WTSL

    More on Wet Seal (WTSLA): Q4 misses on all counts despite a 7% Y/Y jump in revenue. Net earnings...

    More on Wet Seal (WTSLA): Q4 misses on all counts despite a 7% Y/Y jump in revenue. Net earnings actually fell nearly 79% as the teen apparel retailer was hurt by weak demand for its spring fashion merchandise and lighter apparel inventory at its namesake stores. The company adds that it remains cautious about near-term sales expectations, given recent trends. Shares -1.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:34 PM
  • WTSL

    Wet Seal (WTSLA): Q4 EPS of $0.03 in-line. Revenue of $163M (+7% Y/Y) misses by $2.5M. Shares...

    Wet Seal (WTSLA): Q4 EPS of $0.03 in-line. Revenue of $163M (+7% Y/Y) misses by $2.5M. Shares -1.5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • ACN

    More on Accenture (NYSE:ACN) FQ2 beats on both EPS and revenue. Profit rose 12% Y/Y. driven by...

    More on Accenture (NYSE:ACN) FQ2 beats on both EPS and revenue. Profit rose 12% Y/Y. driven by higher sales and operating income, as well as a lower effective tax rate in the quarter. The company raises its FY13 EPS outlook to a range of $3.82 - $3.90, above Street estimates of $3.82. Shares +2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • CPWM

    Cost Plus (NASDAQ:CPWM): Q4 EPS of $1.56 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $364M (+6.6% Y/Y) beats by...

    Cost Plus (NASDAQ:CPWM): Q4 EPS of $1.56 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $364M (+6.6% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM
  • ACN

    Accenture (NYSE:ACN): FQ2 EPS of $0.97 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $6.8B (+12% Y/Y) beats by...

    Accenture (NYSE:ACN): FQ2 EPS of $0.97 beats by $0.11. Revenue of $6.8B (+12% Y/Y) beats by $160M. Shares +2.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • PVH

    Warnaco Group (WRC +0.7%) ticks up after saying earlier it's hired former Gap (GPS +0.7%) Senior...

    Warnaco Group (WRC +0.7%) ticks up after saying earlier it's hired former Gap (GPS +0.7%) Senior Vice President Karyn Hillman to lead the merchandising of its Calvin Klein business as the apparel company looks to expand into new markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • X

    Among the day's biggest decliners amid signs of slowing growth in China and Europe are commodity...

    Among the day's biggest decliners amid signs of slowing growth in China and Europe are commodity producers. "What you had was continued speculation on the depths of the Chinese slowdown and the uncertainty surrounding the Chinese data," one strategist says. “Both those factors immediately hit materials." X -5.9%, NUE -1.4%, AKS -2.2%, FCX -3.7%, AA -2.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:58 PM | 4 Comments
  • SIG

    Signet Jewelers (SIG -4%) slips on a mixed Q4 result, beating on a per share basis but coming up...

    Signet Jewelers (SIG -4%) slips on a mixed Q4 result, beating on a per share basis but coming up short on revenue. Earnings rose 49% Y/Y as the jewelry seller benefited from moderate sales growth at its U.S. stores, but the stock is trading off as same store sales appear to be showing signs of peaking.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:48 PM
  • INFO

    IHS (IHS -4.8%) slides after its FQ1 results came in short of Street estimates earlier today....

    IHS (IHS -4.8%) slides after its FQ1 results came in short of Street estimates earlier today. Earnings fell 26%, primarily on restructuring charges. Separately, the company also unveiled plans to acquire market-research and consultancy provider IMS Research for $46M. Jefferies downgrades the shares to Neutral on the back of the report.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 PM
  • HIG

    John Paulson may want Hartford (HIG -3.7%) to spin off its property-casualty arm, but former top...

    John Paulson may want Hartford (HIG -3.7%) to spin off its property-casualty arm, but former top New Jersey insurance regulator Tom Considine notes that such a decision can't be made without regulatory input. Spinning off property-casualty and leaving a “less vibrant part behind would be closely scrutinized,” he says, adding, "Approval would be unlikely in this environment."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • CLC

    Clarcor's (CLC -4.1%) FQ1 earnings rose 7.3% but missed expectations by a penny, and revenue...

    Clarcor's (CLC -4.1%) FQ1 earnings rose 7.3% but missed expectations by a penny, and revenue missed estimates in the filter and packaging company's three business segments. BB&T cut expectations for the fiscal year, and Gabelli calls the results "fairly disappointing" while believing CLC offered conservative guidance given the quarter's weakness.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:45 PM
  • CVO

    Easy come, easy go. Printing services provider Cenveo (CVO -22.8%), which surged earlier this...

    Easy come, easy go. Printing services provider Cenveo (CVO -22.8%), which surged earlier this month thanks to a strong Q4 report and debt repurchase plans, gets hammered after announcing a $75M convertible debt offering, and reducing the size of its cash tender offer for 7.875% senior notes from $271M to a mere $45M.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:35 PM
  • PERY

    Perry Ellis (PERY +2.5%) powers higher despite a 77% slump in Q4 earnings after the apparel...

    Perry Ellis (PERY +2.5%) powers higher despite a 77% slump in Q4 earnings after the apparel company struggled to compete during the holiday selling season. But adjusted earnings came in at the top of expectations, and PERY said it identified smaller brands and businesses it plans to liquidate and close by the end of 2013.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:32 PM
  • ATU

    Shares of Actuant (ATU -1.9%) take a breather today, despite posting better than expected FQ2...

    Shares of Actuant (ATU -1.9%) take a breather today, despite posting better than expected FQ2 results. Revenue increased by 14% Y/Y, on better margins plus stronger sales from its China and North American operations. The stock is up over 40% since the beginning of the year, and investors appear to be taking the opportunity to sell on the news.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • CHU

    China Unicom (CHU -2.6%) heads lower after reporting a 2011 profit that missed expectations, as...

    China Unicom (CHU -2.6%) heads lower after reporting a 2011 profit that missed expectations, as 3G and broadband subscriber growth fails to offset declining 2G subs and growing handset subsidy costs. Unicom, which plans to spend CNY100B ($15.9B) in 2012 capex, now also has to contend with a loss of Chinese iPhone exclusivity, as rival China Telecom (NYSE:CHA) begins selling the 4S. (earlier)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:15 PM
  • NSR

    NeuStar (NSR +2.9%) gains on an upgrade to Outperform at Baird based on the Targus acquisition...

    NeuStar (NSR +2.9%) gains on an upgrade to Outperform at Baird based on the Targus acquisition and future revenue and cross-selling opportunities. The firm also raises its price target to $45 from $39.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:14 PM
  • RGR

    Have gun stocks, will travel? The runup in weapon makers Sturm Ruger (RGR +13.1%) and Smith...

    Have gun stocks, will travel? The runup in weapon makers Sturm Ruger (RGR +13.1%) and Smith & Wesson (SWHC +12.8%) could just be getting started as the industry sees an ongoing boom in demand. In January, background checks for gun permits rose 17.3% Y/Y - marking the 20th consecutive month of increases. Recent Supreme Court decisions and the reappearance of guns in Wal-Mart have helped stoked sales numbers over the last year. RGR +43.1% YTD, SWHC +77.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 1 Comment
  • LVS

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS +1.4%) moves up after receiving approval from Singapore regulators for the...

    Las Vegas Sands (LVS +1.4%) moves up after receiving approval from Singapore regulators for the first set of licenses to tow junket operators. JP Morgan views this an unexpected positive for the casino operator, and says it will continue to drive upside within the VIP gaming segment.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM
  • DMND

    The Street has decided it's not happy with Diamond Foods' (DMND -7.1%) dividend-suspending,...

    The Street has decided it's not happy with Diamond Foods' (DMND -7.1%) dividend-suspending, interest rate-hiking forebearance agreement after all. Though the agreement results in a relatively modest increase to Diamond's interest expenses, the fact the company needed to restructure so quickly is likely heightening fears about its liquidity situation, and perhaps also its negotiating power with P-E investors.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:56 PM | 2 Comments
  • SONC

    Sonic (SONC -5.3%) slips as its FQ2 revenue disappoints. Earnings fell 61% on weak Y/Y comps, as...

    Sonic (SONC -5.3%) slips as its FQ2 revenue disappoints. Earnings fell 61% on weak Y/Y comps, as the operator of quick- service drive-in restaurants posted a one-time debt-related gain in the year ago period.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:24 PM
  • MLHR

    Herman Miller (MLHR +3.6%) gains despite missing across-the-board on its FQ3 results. Earnings...

    Herman Miller (MLHR +3.6%) gains despite missing across-the-board on its FQ3 results. Earnings actually fell 25% as the office-furniture company reported weaker revenue on a slowdown in U.S. government and health-care sector sales. The stock is trading higher however, after the company announced plans to change its employee retirement programs from a defined benefit-based model to a defined contribution structure.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:19 PM | 1 Comment
  • BAYRY

    Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY -2%) and Regeneron (REGN -1%) lose their U.K. patent fight on Eylea, a...

    Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY -2%) and Regeneron (REGN -1%) lose their U.K. patent fight on Eylea, a potential blockbuster VEGF Tarp-Eye treatment produced jointly by the two companies. A London Court has ruled that the drug infringes a patent held by Roche (OTCQX:RHHBY -1.4%) subsidiary Genentech.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM

  • Associated Press hires Gary Pruitt, head of the McClatchy ([MNIC]] -1.4%) newspaper chain, as...

    Associated Press hires Gary Pruitt, head of the McClatchy ([MNIC]] -1.4%) newspaper chain, as the news group's next president and CEO. 24/7's Doug McIntyre calls Pruitt the "worst CEO in the newspaper industry," citing MNI's dwindling profits and rising debt load in recent years, but shareholders have sent shares lower on the announcement.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:55 PM
  • SBUX

    RBC Capital says that falling coffee prices could boost Starbucks (SBUX +1.4%) FY13 EPS by over...

    RBC Capital says that falling coffee prices could boost Starbucks (SBUX +1.4%) FY13 EPS by over $0.20. The firm increases its FY13 EPS estimate to $2.40, well above the consensus estimate of $2.27, and raises its price target to $62 from $56.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:48 PM
  • ZNGA

    Wall Street likes Zynga's (ZNGA +1.5%) purchase of hot mobile game Draw Something. Baird...

    Wall Street likes Zynga's (ZNGA +1.5%) purchase of hot mobile game Draw Something. Baird analysts say while OMGPOP is a “late bloomer” after launching earlier games, “OMGPOP will add an attractive user to Zynga and... leverage Zynga’s zCloud platform to improve monetization.” Sterne Agee notes Draw Something has passed Words with Friends in downloads recently.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:45 PM
  • TIVO

    B. Riley is out with positive comments on Tivo (TIVO +1%) this morning, saying that Microsoft's...

    B. Riley is out with positive comments on Tivo (TIVO +1%) this morning, saying that Microsoft's (MSFT +0.3%) dismissal its lawsuit removes a cloud for any potential suitor of TIVO that saw it as a deterrent to acquire the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:30 PM
  • BNHN

    Roth Capital says Benihana (BNHN +1.9%) could draw takeover offers after its board announced...

    Roth Capital says Benihana (BNHN +1.9%) could draw takeover offers after its board announced earlier this month that it would explore strategic alternatives. Roth believes that private equity firms as well as the company's management are lining up to potentially submit takeover bids. The firm increases its price target to $17.30 from $15 and reiterates a Buy rating.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • OART

    Mitt Romney wasn't helped by an adviser's ill-advised comparison of the presidential candidate's...

    Mitt Romney wasn't helped by an adviser's ill-advised comparison of the presidential candidate's views to an Etch a Sketch, but shares of Ohio Art (OTCPK:OART +141.2%), maker of the drawing toy, are skyrocketing. The pink-sheet company began selling the toy in 1960, and it was its best-selling product until last year.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 3 Comments
  • LGF.A

    More than just Lions Gate (LGF -5.5%) could enjoy a Hunger Games boost, from booksellers to...

    More than just Lions Gate (LGF -5.5%) could enjoy a Hunger Games boost, from booksellers to movie companies and theaters to toy companies with character tie-ins to capitalize on the franchise, according to Kapitall: SCHL, AMZN, HAS, MAT, IMAX. But trying to play this movie "isn’t a way to make a killing. It’s a way to get killed," Ben Levisohn warns. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM
  • NLY

    Annaly Capital (NLY -1%) slips on a Sterne Agee downgrade to Underperform. The firm cites...

    Annaly Capital (NLY -1%) slips on a Sterne Agee downgrade to Underperform. The firm cites refinancing risk in its large RMBS portfolio.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 9 Comments
  • SCVL

    Susquehanna jumps on the Shoe Carnival (SCVL +16.3%) bandwagon this morning, raising its price...

    Susquehanna jumps on the Shoe Carnival (SCVL +16.3%) bandwagon this morning, raising its price target to $34 from $32 on the back of its solid Q4 results. The firm adds that it expects a strong finish to 2012 due to favorable Q4 weather comparisons and a 53rd retail week.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • WDC

    Western Digital (WDC +3.7%) bucks tech sector weakness, climbing as Needham hikes its rating on...

    Western Digital (WDC +3.7%) bucks tech sector weakness, climbing as Needham hikes its rating on the hard disk-drive maker to Strong Buy. The firm sees the stock as "significantly undervalued” since WDC bought Hitachi’s disk-drive business, a deal which will prove to be "a pivotal point in HDD history and drive record profitability for both WDC and STX."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:39 AM
  • LGF.A

    Lions Gate (LGF -6.1%) gives back a chunk of its recent gains, as Caris' upgrade gets outweighed...

    Lions Gate (LGF -6.1%) gives back a chunk of its recent gains, as Caris' upgrade gets outweighed by a downgrade to Equal Weight from Evercore, as well as cautious remarks from supporter Jim Cramer, who suggests investors take profits ahead of the release of The Hunger Games. A WSJ column questioning whether the movie's financial impact justifies Lions Gate's run-up could also be playing a role.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 1 Comment
  • PCXCQ

    Coal stocks keep up their hypersensitivity to data on the direction of China's economy, falling...

    Coal stocks keep up their hypersensitivity to data on the direction of China's economy, falling hard on today's weak PMI number. It's not without some merit though, given that China consumes a whopping 1.3B short tons a year of coal - 24% more than the U.S. manages to burn. Decliners: PCX -4.9%, CNX -3.9%, ANR -3.9%, BTU -3.2%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:32 AM | 1 Comment
  • FDX

    Despite its bottom-line beat, FedEx (FDX -4%) shares are buckling under the weight of...

    Despite its bottom-line beat, FedEx (FDX -4%) shares are buckling under the weight of disappointing manufacturing data out of China and the shipper's light guidance. Q4 is still expected strong but "we just don’t have as strong an economy as we hoped it would be a year ago,” CFO Alan Graf says, adding that high fuel prices are taking a toll. But many analysts remain optimistic about long-term prospects.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM | 5 Comments
  • WLK

    Westlake Chemical (WLK -5.2%) drops after saying that one of its plants in Louisiana is on fire...

    Westlake Chemical (WLK -5.2%) drops after saying that one of its plants in Louisiana is on fire due to a possible explosion. There are no reported injuries, and fire has apparently been contained.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:08 AM
  • DPZ

    Domino's Pizza (DPZ -2.6%) falls again, hitting new lows since announcing its special $3...

    Domino's Pizza (DPZ -2.6%) falls again, hitting new lows since announcing its special $3 dividend. While some major websites and stock screeners and are showing a 10% beatdown for DPZ on the day, the actual loss is more modest with the stock trading ex-dividend today.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:01 AM
  • CVBF

    Shares of CVB Financial (CVBF -2.1%) dip after being downgraded to Hold on valuation at...

    Shares of CVB Financial (CVBF -2.1%) dip after being downgraded to Hold on valuation at Wunderlich this morning. The stock has been a hard charger during the rally year-to-date, gaining over 60% since last October. The firm maintains its $12 price target.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:44 AM
  • EDMC

    Education Management (EDMC +2.4%) trades higher after Morgan Stanley chimes in with a timely...

    Education Management (EDMC +2.4%) trades higher after Morgan Stanley chimes in with a timely upgrade to Equal Weight from Underweight on a valuation call. Shares of EDMC -40.6% YTD.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:41 AM
  • SCVL

    Shoe Carnival (SCVL +14.9%) soars after its FQ4 results surpass its revised guidance. Also...

    Shoe Carnival (SCVL +14.9%) soars after its FQ4 results surpass its revised guidance. Also helping is its guidance for FQ1 revenue of $219M-$222M and EPS of $0.75-$0.78 (consensus is for $207.7M and $0.70) on the back of 5.5%-7% same-store sales growth. Sterne Agee is upgrading shares to Buy, arguing Shoe Carnival is benefiting from a "very strong athletic cycle," and is taking share from larger family footwear rivals.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:38 AM
  • TSLA

    Luxury electric auto maker Tesla Motors (TSLA -1.7%) is reportedly using customer down payments...

    Luxury electric auto maker Tesla Motors (TSLA -1.7%) is reportedly using customer down payments to finance its operations and stay in business. If revenue from down payments decreases, the company would become more dependent on the federal government, whose assistance to clean energy companies is coming under increasing scrutiny.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM | 19 Comments
  • KKD

    Shares of Krispy Kreme (KKD -6.8%) trail off - giving back much of the gains built up following...

    Shares of Krispy Kreme (KKD -6.8%) trail off - giving back much of the gains built up following its earnings report earlier this week - as the company continues to battle the "stigma" that it grew too fast and swallowed up too much debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:25 AM
  • WP

    Payment processor Vantiv (VNTV) joins ExactTarget in having a successful IPO day. Shares are...

    Payment processor Vantiv (VNTV) joins ExactTarget in having a successful IPO day. Shares are currently trading at $19.12, up 12.5% from an offering price of $17. The company currently sports a market cap of $4.08B. Vantiv generated revenue of $1.62B (+40% Y/Y) in 2011, and net income of $84.8M. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:24 AM
  • OPEN

    Benchmark's James Dobson follows his upgrade of OpenTable (OPEN +2.3%) with comments on a SF...

    Benchmark's James Dobson follows his upgrade of OpenTable (OPEN +2.3%) with comments on a SF Chronicle article touting rival Urbanspoon (IACI) as seating 1M diners per month using its automated reservation system. OPEN isn't seriously threatened, Dobson says: Urbanspoon has just 11% of OPEN’s volume, and has ~1,200 restaurants signed up vs. OPEN’s 17,150.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:17 AM
  • RGR

    Sturm, Ruger (NYSE:RGR) starts off like a speeding bullet, climbing 7.2% after the firearms...

    Sturm, Ruger (NYSE:RGR) starts off like a speeding bullet, climbing 7.2% after the firearms company says it's stopped taking new orders due to overwhelming demand, having received bookings for over 1M units in Q1. Sturm, Ruger expects to "resume the normal acceptance of orders by the end of May." Smith & Wesson (SWHC +12.17%) flies higher also. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM | 4 Comments

  • Precious metals continue a decline which began around the start of March, touching their lowest...

    Precious metals continue a decline which began around the start of March, touching their lowest levels since January. Gold -1.3% to $1,631/oz., silver -2.5% to $31.41. Of continuing concern is higher import duties for gold in India where jewelers are expected to reopen today after a week-long strike.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:08 AM
  • ET-OLD

    After pricing its 8.5M share IPO at $19, ExactTarget (NYSE:ET-OLD) is trading at $24.62, up...

    After pricing its 8.5M share IPO at $19, ExactTarget (NYSE:ET-OLD) is trading at $24.62, up 29.6%. ExactTarget, a provider of cloud-based online marketing software that counts Microsoft, Priceline, and Groupon among its customers, currently sports a market cap of $1.59B. The company posted revenue of $207.5M (+54% Y/Y) in 2011, and a net loss of $35.4M. Sales & marketing expected amounted to 45% of revenue. (S-1)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:03 AM
  • CAT

    One of the Dow’s key pillars is showing weakness: Shares of Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) are...

    One of the Dow’s key pillars is showing weakness: Shares of Caterpillar (NYSE:CAT) are riding a four-day losing streak, tumbling 4%. Earlier this week, CAT disclosed dealer sales slowed in the last three months, raising concerns about growth prospects. CAT is a major contributor to the price-weighted DJIA; it accounted for 34% of the Dow’s 415-point advance in January. CAT -1.6% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:21 AM | 10 Comments

  • Market preview: More strong weekly jobless data makes little impression on EU shares, U.S....

    Market preview: More strong weekly jobless data makes little impression on EU shares, U.S. futures and oil, which are all down following PMI data that further confirms that things 'aint looking good in China or the eurozone. S&P Benchmark -0.5%. Randgold -11.5% after a coup in Mali, while McDonald's (-0.6%) is little moved by the retirement of its CEO. Later: FHFA House Price Index, Fed's Bernanke, Dudley
     
     
     
     
    | 9:16 AM | 1 Comment
  • GME

    GameStop (GME +3.8%) reverses the knee-jerk fall on a revenue miss and weak guidance. Digital...

    GameStop (GME +3.8%) reverses the knee-jerk fall on a revenue miss and weak guidance. Digital sales +57% Y/Y shows the company successfully shifting to a new revenue model, says Frank Voisin, also noting the company is now debt-free. "When you trade at 4.8X free cash flow and 40.9% of the float is short, the bar is low," comments Joe Kunkle. (also)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:03 AM
  • OPEN

    Raymond James upgrades OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN) to Outperform from Market Perform, following up...

    Raymond James upgrades OpenTable (NASDAQ:OPEN) to Outperform from Market Perform, following up on a ringing endorsement from Benchmark yesterday. Shares +3.5% premarket.
